Description:
Informatica Developer Job Duties
Informatica developers have a wide range of responsibilities, which can include:
Analyzing data to determine structure, creating databases, and developing software applications
Creating business requirements documents and translating them into technical specifications for software development teams
Developing scripts or programs to automate repetitive tasks in the data management process
Evaluating new technologies and recommending changes to existing systems based on their findings
Collaborating with other IT professionals, such as system analysts and database administrators, to design new computer programs or update existing ones
Troubleshooting problems with existing computer systems and recommending solutions
Creating and maintaining databases to store and organize information
Designing and developing new applications, including writing code in programming languages such as Java, C#, or C++
Providing technical support for software applications and databases, including responding to users’ questions about features and functionality
Requirements:
Informatica Developer Job Requirements
In order to become an Informatica developer, you will likely need to have the following:
Education: Informatica developers typically need a bachelor’s degree in computer science, information technology or a related field. Some employers prefer candidates who have a master’s degree in computer science or information technology.
Training & Experience: Informatica developers typically receive on-the-job training after being hired. This training is usually part of the onboarding process and may last for a few weeks. During this time, the developer will learn about the company’s culture, policies and procedures. They will also learn about the software and systems they will be using.
Informatica developers can also receive training through conferences and seminars. These events are often hosted by Informatica or other software companies. They provide attendees with the latest information about data integration and analytics.
Certifications & Licenses: Informatica developers are not required to hold any certifications to earn their degree, but they can choose to take and pass one or more certifications to demonstrate their skills to potential employers.
Informatica Developer Skills
Informatica developers need the following skills in order to be successful:
Coding: Coding is the process of writing computer programs. It’s important for informatica developers to have strong coding skills so they can create the software their company needs. Coding skills can include both programming languages and frameworks.
Database management: Database management is the ability to create, update and maintain databases. This is an important skill for informatica developers because they often work with large amounts of data. Database management involves knowing how to store and organize data, as well as how to retrieve data when needed.
 Communication: As an informatica developer, you need to communicate with other team members and clients. You need to be able to explain technical concepts to non-technical people and vice versa. You also need to be able to communicate complex ideas in simple terms.
Problem-solving: Problem-solving skills allow you to identify and resolve issues that arise during the development process. As an informatica developer, you may be responsible for identifying and resolving issues that arise during testing or production. Your ability to identify and resolve issues can help you develop software that functions as intended.
Teamwork: Working with other team members is an important part of a data analyst’s job. As an informatica developer, you might work with other developers to create a new program or system. You might also work with other informatica developers to test and improve an existing program or system.
